body: Thanks for reporting this.  I think `include_examples` should definitely include the information you mention.  Also, I've been thinking it would be good for rspec to maintain a shared example group call stack, so that when you include a shared example group in a shared example group, you can trace the entire thing.  The fixes for these two things may be related.
Not yet.  I was thinking I might take it on for 3.2 or 3.3.

Well, it's always nice to get contributions from the community, but in this case, doing this properly is going to require a refactoring of some RSpec internals with regard to how it stores and evaluates shared example groups.  It's the kind of thing that I would expect to be difficult for someone who is not already familiar with the RSpec code base.

It's good to know there's interest in this feature, though; it'll definitely help me prioritize features.

issue.title: Shared Examples: context prevents "it" blocks from being executed when trying to execute them using a line number
issue.body:
Just noticed that my shared examples' `it` blocks were not executed when I ran them with an exact line number like so:

`rspec spec/my_spec.rb:123`

But when I ran them as the whole file, the `it` blocks were executed as expected:

`rspec spec/my_spec.rb`

After some debugging, I found that my shared examples' `it` blocks were in a `context` block - when I removed them, I could successfully execute them using a line number.

Is this a known bug/feature? Should I avoid contexts in shared examples?

issue.title: Improve shared group backtrace in failure output.
issue.body:
- Show all shared group inclusion stack frames,
  not just the inner-most one.
- Make it work for all methods of including
  shared example groups. Previously, it only
  worked for the methods that generate a nested
  group.

Fixes #1209.

body: I've got a fix for this up in #1763, if anyone wants to give it a shot and provide feedback.

@myronmarston Almost nine years later but wanted to check before creating a _new_ issue: Is the expectation that the backtrace includes frames _inside_ the shared example group? I currently have a failure inside a shared example group and all of that info is left out, with the top-most frame being "Shared Example Group: "my group" called from /path/to/spec". Ideally, the backtrace would include the frames inside the shared example group, too.
Would you like to send a PR with a red spec describing how you see the output, @contentfree ?

@contentfree this issue was about the line which included the shared examples, not the backtrace frame inside the shared example group, which I'd expect to be included by default I don't think we filter them, you can check wether your setup is filtering them by using `--backtrace`
